org.ensembl.util
Class FormattedSequencePrintStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      java.io.FilterOutputStream
          java.io.PrintStream
              org.ensembl.util.FormattedSequencePrintStream
public class FormattedSequencePrintStream
extends java.io.PrintStream

Extended PrintStream to allow users to print fasta formatted sequence output with an unformatted header, and sequence formatted to a user-specified column width maximum, using a user supplied line ending. Users should use the normal PrintStream methods to write header elements. Users should use the various *Sequence methods to print out sequences. Note, the default line ending is a newline, but this can be over ridden.

Author:
Darin London, Craig Melsopp

Constructor Detail

FormattedSequencePrintStream

public FormattedSequencePrintStream(int maxColumnLen,
                                    java.io.OutputStream out)
Constructor for a basic FormattedSequencePrintStream, with maxColumn and an underlying OutputStream. The default line ending, a newline, is used to add line endings to sequences. Autoflush is set to false.

Parameters:
maxColumnLen - - integer, column length max. A maxColumnLen of 0 signals that no formatting should occur
out - - underlying OutputStream for the PrintStream

FormattedSequencePrintStream

public FormattedSequencePrintStream(int maxColumnLen,
                                    java.lang.String lineEnd,
                                    java.io.OutputStream out)

FormattedSequencePrintStream

public FormattedSequencePrintStream(int maxColumnLen,
                                    java.io.OutputStream out,
                                    boolean autoFlush)
Constructor for a FormattedSequencePrintStream, stating whether the underlying PrintStream should be in autoFlush mode, or not. The default line ending, a newline, is used to add line endings to sequences.

Parameters:
maxColumnLen - - integer, column length max. A maxColumnLen of 0 signals that no formatting should occur
out - - underlying OutputStream for the PrintStream
autoFlush - - boolean, if true, underlying PrintStream is set to autoFlush true
See Also:
PrintStream

FormattedSequencePrintStream

public FormattedSequencePrintStream(int maxColumnLen,
                                    java.lang.String lineEnd,
                                    java.io.OutputStream out,
                                    boolean autoFlush)
Constructor for a FormattedSequencePrintStream, setting the autoFlush and the lineEnd string to print when adding a line end to formatted sequence output. Useful for output such as HTML, where the newline should be

instead of \n.

Parameters:
maxColumnLen - - integer, column length max. A maxColumnLen of 0 signals that no formatting should occur
lineEnd - - String to end sequence lines with when the formatter inserts a new line to the sequences (default is newline).
out - - underlying OutputStream for the PrintStream
autoFlush - - boolean, if true, underlying PrintStream is set to autoFlush true
See Also:
PrintStream

writeSequence

public void writeSequence(byte[] buf,
                          int off,
                          int len)
write a portion of a byte[] object containing sequence, with formatting.

Parameters:
buf - - byte[] containing sequence bytes to be printed
off - - beginning offset, eg. byte[off] will be the first byte printed
len - - number of bytes to print, eg. byte[off] - byte[off + len - 1] will be printed

resetColumnCount

public void resetColumnCount()
sets the columnCount to 0, to signal that a new output of sequence has begun
